title: Invitation is not properly cancelled while inviting to bug reports.

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
This issue is a little confusing. So, if you are not able to reproduce let me know i will send you a video to help reproduce the issue.

Reproduction Steps :
1) Let's say you are User A who is inviting a user B to abug report, User A goes to + sign(adding participants) and adds a email address there.
2) User B gets an email immediately about an invitation, he accepts it and sees the bug report.
3) User A after few minutes of sending invitations realizes he made a mistake in email, and cancels the invitation which is still showing pending in his side. 
4) User A is shown a message " The invitation to UserB has been successfully rejected.", he thinks now the User B is not able to see the bug report anymore. But to his expectation, User B can still see the bug report.

So what is happening?
When User A clicked on the cancel sign to invitation that showed "pending", the cancel signed only made the invitation send to email invalid. But since user B has already accepted the invitation, User A's clicking on him won't remove User B from the bug report.

So what should have actually happened?
When User A clicked on cancel sign to invitation that was showing "pending", it should check if the user B has already join the bug report or not. And if User B hasn't it should make invitation code invalid, and if User B has already accepted and joined the Bug report, it should revoke the User B's access from Bug report.

I hope this clear enough to understand.
vulnerability_information_html:
This issue is a little confusing. So, if you are not able to reproduce let me know i will send you a video to help reproduce the issue.

Reproduction Steps :
1) Let's say you are User A who is inviting a user B to abug report, User A goes to + sign(adding participants) and adds a email address there.
2) User B gets an email immediately about an invitation, he accepts it and sees the bug report.
3) User A after few minutes of sending invitations realizes he made a mistake in email, and cancels the invitation which is still showing pending in his side.
4) User A is shown a message " The invitation to UserB has been successfully rejected.", he thinks now the User B is not able to see the bug report anymore. But to his expectation, User B can still see the bug report.

So what is happening?
When User A clicked on the cancel sign to invitation that showed "pending", the cancel signed only made the invitation send to email invalid. But since user B has already accepted the invitation, User A's clicking on him won't remove User B from the bug report.

So what should have actually happened?
When User A clicked on cancel sign to invitation that was showing "pending", it should check if the user B has already join the bug report or not. And if User B hasn't it should make invitation code invalid, and if User B has already accepted and joined the Bug report, it should revoke the User B's access from Bug report.

I hope this clear enough to understand.

activities.message:
Hi @batman,

I can see what you're attempting to do; however, I am unable to reproduce the issue using the provided steps. Specifically:

_Discrepancy 1:_
In your step 4, you mention getting a confirmation message about successful rejection of the invitation. After User B has accepted the invite, having User A click `Cancel` on the pending invite instead results in a `404 Not Found` response and a `Page not found` error page. See my attached screenshot for reference.

_Discrepancy 2:_
> When User A clicked on the cancel sign to invitation that showed "pending", the cancel signed only made the invitation send to email invalid.
I'm not sure I fully understand what you meant here, but no email should be generated by clicking `Cancel` on the pending invitation.

Given the behavior I am seeing, there shouldn't be any confusion where User A ends up thinking User B has been declined access to the team. If User A sees the error page and goes back to the User Management page, User B will now be listed under the members list and can be removed using the `Remove` link.

If you feel this is incorrect, please do provide a video of the workflow and any additional data (like request/response data) that could be helpful in reproducing the issue. Thanks!
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @batman,

I can see what you're attempting to do; however, I am unable to reproduce the issue using the provided steps. Specifically:

Discrepancy 1:
In your step 4, you mention getting a confirmation message about successful rejection of the invitation. After User B has accepted the invite, having User A click Cancel on the pending invite instead results in a 404 Not Found response and a Page not found error page. See my attached screenshot for reference.

Discrepancy 2:

When User A clicked on the cancel sign to invitation that showed "pending", the cancel signed only made the invitation send to email invalid.
I'm not sure I fully understand what you meant here, but no email should be generated by clicking Cancel on the pending invitation.

Given the behavior I am seeing, there shouldn't be any confusion where User A ends up thinking User B has been declined access to the team. If User A sees the error page and goes back to the User Management page, User B will now be listed under the members list and can be removed using the Remove link.

If you feel this is incorrect, please do provide a video of the workflow and any additional data (like request/response data) that could be helpful in reproducing the issue. Thanks!

activities.message:
Also it seems there is another bug here.
Once a userB accepts invitation, and userA then wants to revoke his access and clicks on remove UserB, userB is removed and his access his revoked from bug report. But UserB will now show as "Team Member" in User A's bug report.
Here is a video of it:
http://youtu.be/95PA3q4Nk0M
activities.markdown_message:
Also it seems there is another bug here.
Once a userB accepts invitation, and userA then wants to revoke his access and clicks on remove UserB, userB is removed and his access his revoked from bug report. But UserB will now show as "Team Member" in User A's bug report.
Here is a video of it:
http://youtu.be/95PA3q4Nk0M

activities.message: I forgot to mention, the user who is now showed as "Team Member" cannot be removed from team member from that bug report (the user doesn't actually become a team member, but the "participants" section of the bug report shows so)
activities.markdown_message: I forgot to mention, the user who is now showed as "Team Member" cannot be removed from team member from that bug report (the user doesn't actually become a team member, but the "participants" section of the bug report shows so)

activities.message:
@batman, thank you for the video. I was able to reproduce the behavior and it appears to be a valid issue so we'll need some time to investigate. We'll get back to you with any updates.

On the other hand, the bug with the revoked user showing as a Team Member is a known issue already in our bug queue.
activities.markdown_message:
@batman, thank you for the video. I was able to reproduce the behavior and it appears to be a valid issue so we'll need some time to investigate. We'll get back to you with any updates.

On the other hand, the bug with the revoked user showing as a Team Member is a known issue already in our bug queue.

activities.message: Hey @batman, we've recently pushed a fix to production that should solve the bug where you are unable to remove certain participants. Could you verify that this is the case?
activities.markdown_message: Hey @batman, we've recently pushed a fix to production that should solve the bug where you are unable to remove certain participants. Could you verify that this is the case?

activities.message:
Hey @siebejan 
Not sure which bug you are indicating to, but it seems the bug i reported has been fixed.
When i click on remove participants, after the participants has joined the bug report, instead of previous behaviour which showed "The invitation to UserB has been successfully rejected." it now gives "Sorry, but we are unable to remove the external reporter from the report. Please try again later, or contact support@hackerone.com if this problem persists."
activities.markdown_message:
Hey @siebejan
Not sure which bug you are indicating to, but it seems the bug i reported has been fixed.
When i click on remove participants, after the participants has joined the bug report, instead of previous behaviour which showed "The invitation to UserB has been successfully rejected." it now gives "Sorry, but we are unable to remove the external reporter from the report. Please try again later, or contact support@hackerone.com if this problem persists."

activities.message:
Hey @batman,

Sorry for not getting back to you immediately. The message you are seeing ("Sorry ... try again later"), wasn't exactly what we had intended.
Give us sometime to figure things out, and we'll get back to you.
